x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Charities get a lot of stuff they don't need and not enough of the stuff they actually do. This app fixes that by creating a public "wishlist" so people know exactly what to donate.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. The charity posts its wishlist on a public website.
  2. You visit the site, pick an item you want to donate, and pledge it.
  3. The list updates automatically.
  4. You get a confirmation email telling you where to drop it off.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

The core solution does not require any external technical integrations to function and can be developed entirely within the platform.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Keeping the list fresh: The charity must keep the wishlist updated, or the whole thing is useless.
  2. Pledge no-shows: Some people will pledge to donate but never show up.
  3. Getting people to use it: You have to tell the community to check the website first instead of just dropping off random bags of stuff.
  4. It doesn't stop random donations: People will still drop off things that aren't on the list, so the charity still has to sort donations.
